intro: Erythrina pulcherrima, commonly known as the coral tree, is a tropical leguminous plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking red, flame-like flowers that bloom in spring and summer. The plant has trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. Its distinctive bright red flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as birds and bees. The coral tree is often cultivated for its aesthetic value and is also used in traditional medicine.
